itemDescription: British First World War flying ace

wikipedia_page.main: Captain Thomas Vicars Hunter (2 April 1897 – 5 December 1917) was a British First World War flying ace credited with five aerial victories. While serving in the Rifle Brigade he had a leg amputated following a motorcycle accident; he was the first known military pilot to qualify and fly in combat despite his disability.

response: * Thomas Hunter (New York politician) (1834–1903), New York politician

* Thomas Hunter (actor) (1932–2017), American actor who appeared in several Italian films
* Thomas Hunter (school founder) (1831–1915), founder of Hunter College in New York
* Thomas Hunter (dentist) (1863–1958), New Zealand dentist and public health administrator
* Thomas Hunter (RFC officer) (1897–1917), World War I flying ace
* Thomas Hunter, fictional protagonist of Ted Dekker's Circle Trilogy
